location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has obscured some of the body of the letter at the bottom of f. 94v. As a result, the text in this area is difficult to read.

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of a command, which instructed the Resident to forward a letter to Nusser Ulla Khan, dispatched 1 February 1808 and reports that an account has been received of property plundered by Sheik Rehma. It also reports that he has received no accounts of Sir Harford Jones [Brydges].One enclosure; translation of a letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith to Nasser Oolah Khan [Nusser Ulla Khan], Sheraz [Shiraz]. It informs the recipient that he is forwarding a letter received from Bombay. It also notes the remaining balance of plundered company property. However, information on the exact nature of this balance has been lost as a result of pest damage.
